Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.  

 

Title: ‚ÄúThe Bats mechanics‚Äù  

 

Text: ‚ÄúI think it would be great if the bats had new mechanics, you don't need a big change, with new behaviors it would be enough Something like they're neutral, that if you attack them attack you, or if you're in a dark place and put a torch or something shiny, they attack you. If the player is attacked, he may feel nauseous, which represents a lack of blood. They could spawn in large quantities, such as in real life, because bats usually always go in groups, they could also attack fish, as in real life, representing how bats feed on fish. They could also take items from the floor and take them away.

I guess they could drop something, but I don't think it's necessary to make the bat any more interesting.‚Äù 

- Translated by Admin
add details to these mobs tell us what they would do
Tell more people about this so this can get more votes.

Maybe they could be retextured and renamed to netherite golems, which you would make by putting a pumpkin on a T of ancient debris.  The monstrosity would be made with netherite blocks instead of debris.  Cobblestone drops are replaced with basalt, and redstone dust would be replaced with netherite scraps.   The redstone blocks would be replaced with netherite blocks.  The netherite monstrosity would do 20 damage and have twice the health of the new warden.  It could be a late game way of getting rid of the warden.
There should be gold and silver and iron knights and they should drop armor called like (knight boots) or (knight chestplate)
Maybe there can also be 3 different types of knights, iron, gold, and diamond?
maybe they can be tamed

My idea for knights would be a 'tameable' villager which follows the player (with a limit of 1 or 2 active followers) that can be told to stop on a certain position much like other followers.
This way they can be placed to defend strategic positions built by the player, which are not in/near a village with a golem.
This would be similar to the illagers guarding their towers.

Additionally, I would certainly want them to be customized with player-made armor and shields (limited up to iron?), so they can show the flag of their 'owner'.
This creates amazing RP opportunities as well as an actual function for all those wonderful defensive positions we build. I imagine men with (cross)bows on towers and walls and those with swords standing guard at the gate. This simply doesn't work with iron golems.

It would be wonderful to be able to create them with a unique job block but it makes sense to make this really expensive, to prevent players from spawning entire armies.
As such the block would have to be activated with rare items like blocks of emerald.

At the moment I am feeling rather 'lonely' in single-player as I am the only one walking around with my banner, building empty castles and unmanned defenses.
Gold nugget piles will be like snow but with gold nuggets
This is a good idea.
